title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
desc: A self-improvement book that provides actionable strategies to build good habits, break bad ones, and master the tiny behaviors that lead to remarkable results.

author: George Orwell
desc: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
desc: A novel about racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

title: गोदान (Godan)
author: Munshi Premchand
desc: A Hindi novel about the struggles of Indian farmers and social issues.

title: राग दरबारी (Raag Darbari)
author: Shrilal Shukla
desc: A satirical Hindi novel depicting the political and social realities of rural India.

title: ノルウェイの森 (Norwegian Wood)
author: Haruki Murakami
desc: A Japanese coming-of-age novel dealing with love and loss.

title: 源氏物語 (The Tale of Genji)
author: Murasaki Shikibu
desc: A classic Japanese novel often considered the world’s first full-length novel.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
desc: A classic romance novel about love, class, and social expectations.

title: मधुशाला (Madhushala)
author: Harivansh Rai Bachchan
desc: A famous Hindi poetry book symbolizing life as a tavern and its challenges.

title: 吾輩は猫である (I Am a Cat)
author: Natsume Sōseki
desc: A satirical Japanese novel narrated by a stray cat observing human society.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
desc: A novel about wealth, love, and the American Dream during the Jazz Age.
